title: Bind packetNum into AES-GCM AAD for authenticated packet numbering

title: Fix: gohook CGEventTap deadlocks main queue on every keypress
description: On macOS, gohook's hook_run() calls dispatch_sync_f(main_queue, ...) on every keypress to perform Unicode character lookup. Since listener.Start() is called from a goroutine (not the main OS thread), dispatch_sync_f deadlocks because Go's main goroutine never pumps the GCD main queue. This causes the CGEventTap to timeout and be disabled, leaving the app unresponsive to key events and preventing clean exit.\n\nFix: Run listener.Start() on the main OS thread (with runtime.LockOSThread()) by moving the event processing loop to a separate goroutine. This makes event_loop == CFRunLoopGetMain(), which skips the dispatch_sync_f path in process_key_pressed and calls keycode_to_lookup directly instead.
close_reason: Fixed by running listener.Start() on the main OS thread (with runtime.LockOSThread()) and moving the event processing select loop to a goroutine. This ensures CGEventTap runs on the main thread, making event_loop == CFRunLoopGetMain() in hook_run(), which skips the dispatch_sync_f(main_queue,...) deadlock path.

title: Hotkey keypresses echo to terminal during recording
description:
When holding the record hotkey (ctrl+shift+r), keystrokes pass through to the terminal and get echoed. Root cause: gohook's async architecture means the C-level CGEventTap callback returns events to the OS before Go code can suppress them. The event.reserved consumption mechanism exists in C but is never triggered by dispatch_proc.

Options (simplest to most involved):
1. Change default hotkey to something that doesn't produce terminal output (F5, F13-F24, modifier-only combo)
2. Fork gohook and add synchronous key filtering in C dispatch_proc (return NULL for matching combos)
3. Replace gohook with a custom minimal CGEventTap wrapper that does synchronous filtering in C
4. Post-hoc cleanup: send backspace keystrokes after recording stops (fragile)

Relevant code: internal/hotkey/hotkey.go, gohook v0.42.3 hook_c.h (CGEventTapCreate with kCGEventTapOptionDefault)
